contextId.information: The words "wept" and "cried loudly" mean basically the same thing and emphasize how much David mourned for Abner. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: The king wept and cried loudly

contextId.information: Here the word "house" represents David's descendants, who will rule as kings. Here "kingdom" means about the same thing as "house." This can also be stated in active form. AT: "You will live to see me establish your family and their rule over the people of Israel forever" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Your house and kingdom will be confirmed forever before you

contextId.information: These words mean basically the same thing and are used together to emphasize how weak David was. AT: "weak" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
